list_definition.definition: to suggest or hint without actually stating

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Are you implying that I am a liar?

list_ex_of_english: In describing earthwork surveys as 'largely sterile' we are not implying any lack of meaning.
The definition mentions neither perfect friendship nor something which implies perfect friendship.
As implied by the typical concerns expressed in the above quotes, it is also an issue of practical significance.
Clearly this is not what was implied in the discussion of the consequences of damage to the various brain regions implicated in planning.
He is made of thicker stuff, it is implied, and blood is, of course, thicker than water.
The law holds that the owner has implied that the merchant is the owner or has authority over them.
The southern diet implied a grave calorific deficit.
Certainly, it was not as simple as all this; village identity did not take hold as quickly as might seem implied here.
